claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination broadens the MHC-I immunopeptidome.

evidence.quote: Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape
A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

claims.caveat: Mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Type I interferon signaling is necessary for the sensitization effect.

evidence.quote: Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

claims.caveat: Mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination is associated with improved survival in ICI-treated metastatic patients.

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination increases PD-L1 expression in tumor tissue.

evidence.quote: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue | 2.4x
PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.
